column1: <td height="107" colspan="6"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
Simon Green taught German and French in Yorkshire before
becoming Senior Lecturer in Education and German at Trinity
and All Saints College, Leeds in 1991. He became Co-ordinator
of the Comenius Yorkshire and the Humber in 1994 and
is widely involved in delivering training courses to MFL
teachers. Simon's special interests are creative language learning,
A level languages and the European dimension.
In 2000, he was made Chevalier dans l'Ordre des Palmes Acadé
column2: miques by the French Embassy. He has written Actions

column1: stations! Transforming language learning through creative
strategies with Steve Haworth. In 2004, Simon became Lead Manager of Comenius Yorkshire and the Humber.
Steve Haworth taught French and Spanish in Yorkshire before
becoming Teacher Advisor for MFL in Bradford in 1993.
In 1996 he became Education Inspector/Advisor where, apart
from working with inspection teams, he delivered courses
on teaching and learning and leadership and management.
He joined the Comenius team in January 2002 and is widely
involved in delivering training courses to MFL teachers.
Steve also works for the Specialist Schools and Academies Trust and CILT as a
consultant. He has co-authored a number of French and
Spanish publications including<a href="http://www.cilt.org.uk/publications/secondary.htm#action"> Actions stations! Transforming language learning through
creative strategies with Simon Green. In 2000, he was made Chevalier dans l'Ordre des Palmes Acadé

Catherine Cheater is a Language Teaching Consultant, specialising in language teaching in the primary phase. She is renowned as a trainer in this field, having previously been an Advisory Teacher for PMFL in Croydon LEA and more recently Senior Language Teaching Adviser at CILT, The National Centre for Languages.
Catherine has written two  CILT Young Pathfinders &ndash
column3: s Join in! (YPF6) with Dr Cynthia Martin, and The Literacy Link (YPF9) with Anne Farren.

column1: Her areas of special interest include the links between learning another language and the development of literacy skills in young learners, linguistic progression in the primary phase, and the use of music, movement, drama and poetry in the teaching of languages to the very young.
In 2004 Catherine was made a  Chevalier dans l&rsquo
column3: miques, in recognition of her outstanding contribution to the development of French teaching in primary schools in England.

column1: <span class="maintext">Wendy  taught French, Spanish and German for 10 years and now works as a trainer and  consultant.&nbsp
column2: She is the lead tutor for  the CILT Graduate Teacher Programme in Leeds  and regularly&nbsp
column3: delivers MFL-specific  interactive whiteboard training in schools.&nbsp
column4: She has also acted as a consultant for the BBC digital curriculum, is  the ICT consultant for Comenius Yorkshire and the Humber  and has recently acted as consultant for a KS3 Strategy project relating to how  interactive whiteboards can improve learning modern languages.&nbsp
column5: She is the MFL moderator for the Ngfl Teacher Resource Exchange and writes regularly for the TES on matters relating to MFL.

column1: <span class="maintext">Martine Pillette is a very experienced trainer and author  and is in high demand as an excellent presenter at many modern languages  conferences around the country. She has  recently appeared at Language World, the NALA conference (for Language  Advisers) and a national CILT conference in London. She is the author of several modern languages publications  including &ldquo
column3: a text book for KS3 French.&nbsp
column4: She was a KS3 consultant and an adviser on the &ldquo
column5: Framework for teaching modern languages in KS3&rdquo
column6: and has recently been appointed Regional Trainer for KS3 Languages with Comenius Yorkshire and the Humber.

column1: Martine is also in demand as an excellent trainer for A/S  and A2 French and she has devised her own highly original and popular course  &ldquo
column2: La France  des douze derniers mois&rdquo
column4: She has presented this course in several venues and has received outstanding evaluations.

column1: We are delighted that Martine is continuing her association with Comenius Yorkshire and the Humber by running several courses in Leeds in 2006/07.
